abstract: The proposed Google merger could still be held up in Europe, where personal privacy has more legal protections than in the United States.
snippet: The proposed Google merger could still be held up in Europe, where personal privacy has more legal protections than in the United States.
lead_paragraph: THE Federal Trade Commission said Thursday that it had cleared Google’s proposed merger with DoubleClick, the digital marketing company, saying that the deal was “unlikely to substantially lessen competition” in the Internet advertising realm.

headline.print_headline: DoubleClick and Google Get a Clearance to Merge
